question: Which of these planes is now flying in Washington’s skies?
description: Mitsubishi’s MRJ90 is going through flight testing at Moses Lake, with additional work expected to employ 150 in Seattle.

question: Microsoft’s share price climbed past $60, breaking a record set in:
description: Climbing past $59.56 in October on the strength of strong cloud-computing results meant Microsoft’s share price eclipsed its previous record set in 1999.

question: Which of these was not a new Seattle-area public company in 2016?
description: Approvio does not (yet) exist. Impinj, Fortive, Aptevo and Apptio were all added to the roster of local public companies in 2016.

question: Construction in Seattle reached such a frenzy that the city’s crane count this summer was:
description: Seattle’s 58 construction cranes last summer outnumbered any other U.S. city, putting it 18 higher than 2nd ranked Los Angeles and ahead of New York and San Francisco combined.

question: In the first year after the Port of Seattle and Port of Tacoma combined seaports into the Northwest Seaport Alliance, their share of the West Coast cargo market has:
description: The combined seaport operation for Seattle and Tacoma has seen market share increase in its first year.

question: Which iconic Northwest company marked its 100th anniversary this year?
Which of these well-known figures in local business passed away in 2016?
description: Dick Cooley, Dick Spady and Joe Sutter all passed away in 2016.

question:
The local company that pulled in the largest private funding round from investors
in 2016 was:
description: OfferUp raised $130 million in 2016, making it the only so-called ‘unicorn’ (valued at more than $1 billion) among local private tech companies.

question: Which of these did not happen in 2016?
description: None of those happened in 2016, although Costco had been expected to open its first store outside Paris.

question: Satya Nadella, Microsoft’s 48-year-old CEO, announced this summer he’s writing a mid-career autobiographical book called:
description: Satya Nadella’s publisher said his book, due out next year, will be called “<a href="http://www.seattletimes.com/business/microsoft/nadella-is-writing-hit-refresh-on-his-life-and-microsofts/">Hit Refresh<a/>.”

question: King County’s median price for single-family homes and condos rose how much, year over year, according to the latest Northwest Multiple Listing Service report?
description: King County’s median price for both single-family homes and condos rose 10 percent from November 2015 to November 2016, reaching $550,000. Seattle’s median was $615,000.

question: Which company opened a new headquarters in Seattle that designers nicknamed the “tree fort”?
description: Weyerhaeuser relocated from Federal Way to a new headquarters in Seattle’s Pioneer Square.

question: What didn’t Microsoft introduce in 2016?
description: Microsoft, which has cast off virtually all of its acquired Nokia operations, did not debut a new phone in 2016. It did introduce the Xbox One S, the Surface Studio all-in-one computer, and a U.K. cloud-computing center.

question: The largest cargo ship ever to dock on the West Coast, the Benjamin Franklin, visited the Elliott Bay waterfront in February. Megaships of that size are now sailing to Seattle from China:
description: In the wake of a slowdown in ocean shipping, the

question: Concerned that foreign buyers were snapping up homes around Vancouver, B.C., as investments, lawmakers in British Columbia enacted which of these measures?
description: Vancouver, B.C., now has a 15 percent home-sale tax on non-Canadian buyers and a 1 percent tax on homes left empty, thanks to local and provincial lawmakers.
